intro: Eriocoma occidentalis subsp. pubescens, commonly known as the pubescent eriocoma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, pubescent stems and leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in late summer to early fall. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
